value.title: Disneyland in Shanghai set to reopen May 11
value.excerpt: Disneyland in Shanghai, China, is set to reopen May 11 with limited capacity and advanced reservations, the company announced Tuesday. “As the park reopens with significantly enhanced health and safety measures,

value.title: Coronavirus: Schools in China begin to reopen
value.excerpt: Pupils returning to school in China now sit in smaller classes, have shorter lessons and must avoid public transport. The reopening of schools has been staggered so that middle and high schools return first.

images.title: Coronavirus: Schools in China begin to reopen

value.title: VW sees multi-speed coronavirus rebound led by China
value.excerpt: Volkswagen said demand in China was rebounding, thanks to customers who want to switch from public transport to personal vehicles, but warned sales would not recover as quickly in other parts of the world.

images.title: VW sees multi-speed coronavirus rebound led by China

value.title: A China-bashing coronavirus jester? Beijing tears into Pompeo’s ‘clown show’
value.excerpt: China has fired back at Mike Pompeo’s allegations that Beijing is somehow behind the origin and spread of Covid-19, describing his “comedy routine” as deeply cynical and damaging to the United States.

images.title: A China-bashing coronavirus jester? Beijing tears into Pompeo’s ‘clown show’

value.title: European Shares Flat as Mixed Earnings, U.S.-China Tensions Weigh
value.excerpt: European shares opened little changed on Wednesday as a batch of mixed earnings reports and simmering U.S.-China tensions added to doubts about a swift economic recovery even as many countries eased lockdown measures.

images.title: European Shares Flat as Mixed Earnings, U.S.-China Tensions Weigh

value.title: China tourism revenue drops nearly 60% in first major holiday since coronavirus outbreak
value.excerpt: During the Labor Day holiday that ran from May 1 to May 5 this year, China recorded tourism revenue of 47.56 billion yuan ($6.79 billion), down nearly 60% from last year, according to the Ministry of Culture and Tourism.

images.title: China tourism revenue drops nearly 60% in first major holiday since coronavirus outbreak

value.title: Gordon Chang says China's leaders fear 'crime of the century' will be 'exposed' by global coronavirus probe
value.excerpt: Foreign affairs journalist Gordon Chang told "Hannity" Tuesday that the Chinese Communist government is very concerned about the possible exposure of their wrongdoing and incompetence in the handling of the coronavirus.

value.title: Hong Kong business activity shrinks further in April on slumping demand
value.excerpt: Business activity in Hong Kong shrank further in April, a private sector survey showed on Wednesday, as the conronavirus pandemic weighed heavily on demand, output and business confidence.

images.title: Hong Kong business activity shrinks further in April on slumping demand

value.title: Disney rolls out post-COVID-19 plan for reopening Shanghai Disneyland theme park
value.excerpt: Disney laid out a health and safety plan for the reopening of the Shanghai Disneyland theme park on Monday, May 11, following a three-month closure of the park due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

value.title: Coronavirus: Can live-streaming save China's economy?
value.excerpt: "I'm a bit nervous," confessed Li Qiang, the deputy mayor of Wuhan, the Chinese city where the coronavirus was first reported late last year, as he awaited the start of his first-ever TikTok live-streaming event.

images.title: Coronavirus: Can live-streaming save China's economy?

value.title: Hong Kong Tests Traveler Saliva to Thwart Spread of Coronavirus
value.excerpt: Layla Keith had just gotten off a flight from Singapore when she and her fellow passengers were met at the gate by Hong Kong government officials and ushered onto buses that shuttled them to a nearby convention center.

value.title: China pushes back against mounting allegations of coronavirus cover up
value.excerpt: Chinese state media released a cartoon criticizing U.S. accusations as inconsistent and ridiculous. Germany and the UK are among countries now demanding more transparency from China about its initial response to the virus.

value.title: Shanghai Disneyland to reopen after shutting down for coronavirus
value.excerpt: As parts of the world start to reopen amid the coronavirus pandemic, many people are looking to see how businesses will return after closing down. It’s likely that theme park lovers will be interested to see how the Disney parks alter their practices in response to the outbreak.

value.title: Disney takes $1.4 billion coronavirus hit, sets date to reopen Shanghai park
value.excerpt: Walt Disney Co estimated global coronavirus lockdowns cut profits by $1.4 billion, mostly from its shuttered theme parks, but said it would reopen Shanghai Disneyland next week.

value.title: Ears and Masks: Shanghai Disneyland Will Reopen Next Week
value.excerpt: Shanghai Disneyland was among the first of Disney's parks to shut down as the coronavirus pandemic swept Asia in January. Now it will be the first to open its gates again. Disney CEO Bob Chapek announced Monday that the park will re-open on May 11 — but capacity will be limited,

images.title: Ears and Masks: Shanghai Disneyland Will Reopen Next Week

value.title: Disney's Shanghai theme park will reopen Monday
value.excerpt: Theme parks are crucial to Disney's health, and the coronavirus closures cost the company $1 billion in lost income in the first three months of the year.

value.title: Coronavirus survivors want answers, and China is silencing them
value.excerpt: Chinese authorities are clamping down as grieving relatives, along with activists, press the ruling Communist Party for an accounting of what went wrong in Wuhan, the city where the coronavirus killed thousands before spreading to the rest of China and the world.
